data.title: CTET (Level-I) Official Paper-I (Held On: 14 Dec, 2024 Shift 2)

en.value: Kinesthetic learners prefer to learn through ________.

hn.value: गतिसंवेदी शिक्षार्थी _________ के माध्यम से सीखना पसंद करते हैं।

en.value: According to Vygotsky&#39;s theory of learning and development, which of the following is an example of scaffolding ?

options.value: Demonstrating a skill to a student and then having them master it on their own.
Breaking a task down into smaller steps and providing support as needed.
Providing a student with a grade for their work as motivation.
Providing a student with a reading assignment and asking them to answer questions independently.

hn.value: वायगोत्स्की के सीखने और विकास के सिद्धांत के अनुसार, निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा स्कैफोल्डिंग का उदाहरण है?

options.value: <p>किसी <span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">छात्र&nbsp;</span>को किसी कौशल का प्रदर्शन करना और फिर उन्हें स्वयं उसमें महारत हासिल करना।</p>
किसी कार्य को छोटे चरणों में तोड़ना और आवश्यकतानुसार सहायता प्रदान करना।
अभिप्रेरणा के रूप में एक छात्र को उनके काम के लिए एक श्रेणी प्रदान करना।
एक छात्र को पढ़ने का कार्य देना और उन्हें स्वतंत्र रूप से सवालों के जवाब देने के लिए कहना।

en.value: In the constructivist view :

options.value: Learning is simply writing associations on the blank slates of our brains.&nbsp;
Individuals are passively influenced by environmental events.
Individuals are conditioned to learn new behaviours.
Learning is extending and transforming the current understanding.&nbsp;

hn.value: रचनावादी दृष्टिकोण से :

options.value: <p>सीखना बस हमारे मस्तिष्क की खाली स्लेट पर संबंधों को लिखना है।</p>
व्यक्ति पर्यावरणीय घटनाओं से निष्क्रिय रूप से प्रभावित होते हैं।
व्यक्तियों को नए व्यवहार सीखने के लिए अनुकूलित किया जाता है।
सीखना वर्तमान समझ को विस्तारित करना और रूपांतरित करना है।

en.value: Dysgraphia is characterised by:

hn.value: डिस्ग्राफिया की विशेषता यह है:

options.value: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।

en.value: In order to cater to needs of students struggling with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder teachers should avoid :

options.value: Flexibility in curricular materials and instructions
Breaking the task into small easily manageable parts

hn.value: शिक्षकों को ध्यान न्यूनता अतिक्रियाशीलता विकार से जूझ रहे छात्रों की आवश्यकताओं का ध्यान रखते समय __________ से बचना चाहिए।

options.value: बहु - संवेदी सामग्री का उपयोग करने
विकर्षण उत्पन्न करना और शोर मचाना
पाठ्यचर्या संबंधी सामग्रियों और निर्देशों में लचीलापन
कार्य को छोटे-छोटे आसानी से प्रबंधनीय भागों में विभाजित करना

en.value: According to Howard Gardner while a scientist would exhibit high _________&nbsp;Intelligence, a&nbsp;sculptor would have high _________&nbsp;Intelligence.

hn.value: हॉवर्ड गार्डनर के अनुसार, एक वैज्ञानिक उच्च _________ बुद्धि प्रदर्शित करेगा, जबकि एक मूर्तिकार के पास उच्च _________ बुद्धि होगी।

options.value: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।

en.value: Piaget described cognitive development as occurring in:&nbsp;

en.value: Two important cognitive development milestones of sensorimotor stage of Piaget&#39;s theory of cognitive development are:

options.value: Reversibility of thought and hypothetic-deductive reasoning

en.value: Which of the following correctly describes extrinsic motivation&nbsp;?&nbsp;

options.value: Motivation that comes from internal factors.
Motivation that comes from environmental consequences.
Motivation that comes from a sense of personal satisfaction.
Motivation that comes from personal enjoyment of the task.&nbsp;

hn.value: निम्न में से कौन-सा बाह्य&nbsp;अभिप्रेरणा का सही वर्णन करता है?

options.value: अभिप्रेरणा जो आंतरिक कारकों से आती है।
अभिप्रेरणा जो वातावरणीय परिणामों से आती है।
अभिप्रेरणा जो व्यक्तिगत संतुष्टि की भावना से आती है।
अभिप्रेरणा जो कार्य के व्यक्तिगत आनंद से आती है।

en.value: Meaningful learning is primarily NOT about:

hn.value: अर्थपूर्ण अधिगम मुख्य रूप से किसके बारे में नहीं है ?

en.value: According to Vygotsky children speak to themselves:&nbsp;

options.value: To aid thought and for self-regulation.
To provide self-reinforcement when adults are ignoring them.

hn.value: वायगोत्स्की के अनुसार बच्चे स्वयं से बात करते हैं:

options.value: विचार और आत्म-नियमन में सहायता के लिए।
आत्म-सदृढ़ीकरण प्रदान करने के लिए जब वयस्क उन्हें अनदेखा कर रहे हों।

en.value: Which of the following statement represents &#39;Proximodistal&#39; principle of development?

options.value: Children develop ability to sit up before standing.
Identical twins living in different cultures can develop at different rates.
Children develop ability to grasp the ball before putting beads in thread.&nbsp;

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा कथन विकास के &#39;प्रोक्सिमोडिस्टल&#39; सिद्धांत का प्रतिनिधित्व करता है?

options.value: बच्चे खड़े होने से पहले बैठने की क्षमता विकसित करते हैं।
विकास बहु-दिशात्मक और बहु-आयामी होता है।
अलग-अलग संस्कृतियों में रहने वाले हमशक्ल जुड़वां अलग-अलग दरों से विकसित हो सकते हैं।
मोतियों को धागे में पिरोने से पहले बच्चे गेंद को पकड़ने की क्षमता विकसित करते हैं।

en.value: In developmental terms, a time frame where an individual upholds an amplified sensitivity to particular incentives for developing particular skills to function in an efficient manner is referred&nbsp;to as __________&nbsp;of development.

hn.value: <p>विकासात्मक शब्दों में, वह समय-सीमा, जिसमें व्यक्ति कार्यकुशलता से कार्य करने के लिए विशेष कौशल विकसित करने के लिए विशेष प्रोत्साहनों के प्रति अत्यधिक संवेदनशीलता बनाए रखता है, उसे विकास का __________ कहा जाता है।</p>

options.value: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।

en.value: Children -

options.value: Come into this world as tabula rasa or blank slate.
Are born unruly and need to be socialized.
Come into this world with genetic codes that determine their destiny.
Are greatly influenced by the social cultural context they grow up in.

hn.value: बच्चे -

options.value: इस संसार में &#39;खाली स्लेट&#39; या &#39;कोरी पट्टी&#39; के रूप में आते हैं।
अनियंत्रित पैदा होते हैं और उन्हें सामाजिक होने की आवश्यकता होती है।
इस दुनिया में आनुवंशिक कोड के साथ आते हैं जो उनकी नियति तय करते हैं।
उस सामाजिक सांस्कृतिक संदर्भ से बहुत प्रभावित होते हैं जिसमें वे बड़े होते हैं।

en.value: At which level of Kohlberg&#39;s moral development does individual&#39;s ethical behavior mainly depends on the mindset that &quot;what do people think of me&quot;?

hn.value: कोहलबर्ग के नैतिक विकास के किस स्तर पर व्यक्ति का नैतिक व्यवहार मुख्य रूप से इस मानसिकता पर निर्भर करता है कि &quot;लोग मेरे बारे में क्या सोचते हैं&quot;?

options.value: Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।

en.value: Mastery Oriented learners typically attribute success to _______&nbsp;and failure to ________.

options.value: ability and good luck; task difficulty&nbsp;
ability and good luck; low ability&nbsp;

hn.value: निपुणता उन्मुख शिक्षार्थी आमतौर पर सफलता का श्रेय _______ को और असफलता का श्रेय ________ को देते हैं।

options.value: योग्यता और अच्छी किस्मत; कार्य कठिनाई
योग्यता और <span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">प्रयास</span>; खराब किस्मत
योग्यता और अच्छी किस्मत; निम्न योग्यता

en.value: Challenges in social communication are evident in :

hn.value: सामाजिक संचार में चुनौतियाँ किसमें स्पष्ट होती हैं ?

en.value: Children often come up with their own explanations of events around them. On being probed to why does it rain Sia says &quot;God was tired of carrying the buckets of water on his shoulders Such explanations:

options.value: Indicate that children have na&iuml;ve understanding rooted in their cultural context with which they try to understand events.
Depict that children have an egocentric view and cannot consider other&#39;s viewpoint.&nbsp;
<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">Illustrate that children are not capable of any reasoning.</span>
Prove that children&#39;s thinking is much lesser than adults quantitively.

hn.value: बच्चे अक्सर अपने आस-पास की घटनाओं की अपनी व्याख्या लेकर आते हैं।&nbsp;जब सिया से पूछा गया कि बारिश क्यों होती है तो उसने कहा, &quot;भगवान अपने कंधों पर पानी की बाल्टियाँ ढोते-ढोते थक गए थे।&quot;

options.value: संकेत देती हैं कि बच्चों में अपने सांस्कृतिक परिवेश के अनुकूल &#39;सहज&#39; समझ होती है जिससे वे घटनाओं को समझने की कोशिश करते हैं।
चित्रित करती हैं कि बच्चों का एक आत्मकेंद्रित दृष्टिकोण है और वे दूसरे के दृष्टिकोण पर विचार नहीं कर सकते&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">हैं।</span>
स्पष्ट करती हैं कि बच्चे तर्क करने में सक्षम नहीं हैं।
साबित करती हैं कि बच्चों की सोच वयस्कों की तुलना में &#39;मात्रात्मक&#39; रूप से बहुत कम है।

en.value: During play time at school, Rishab, a 7-year-old boy picked a doll to play with. Some of his pee made fun of him for his choice of toy. As a teacher who wants his students to grow up with gender role flexibility, which of the following would be the best response to the situation by the teacher&nbsp;

options.value: Quitely take away the doll and give a car toy to Rishabh without saying anything.
Talk to Rishabh that dolls are suitable for girls and boys should not play with dolls
Tell Rishabh that he should play with something else because his friends won&#39;t approve him playing with doll.
Let Rishabh play with doll and tell other children that they can also choose any toy of the&nbsp;choice.

hn.value: विद्यालय में खेलने के समय, ऋषभ, एक 7 वर्षीय लड़के ने खेलने के लिए एक गुड़िया उठाई। उसके कुछ साथियों ने इस पसंद के खिलौने के लिए उसका मज़ाक उड़ाया। एक शिक्षक जो अपने विद्यार्थियों में लैंगिक भूमिका के सन्दर्भ लचीलापन विकसित करना चाहता है, को इस स्थिति में निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सी प्रतिक्रिया देनी चाहिए?

options.value: बिना कुछ कहे गुड़िया को हटा देना चाहिए और ऋषभ को खेलने के लिए कार दे देनी चाहिए।
ऋषभ से बात करनी चाहिए कि गुड़िया लड़कियों के लिए उपयुक्त हैं और लड़कों को गुड़िया के साथ नहीं खेलना चाहिए।
ऋषभ से कहना चाहिए कि वह किसी और खिलौने के साथ खेले क्योंकि उसके दोस्तों को यह मंज़ूर नहीं है कि गुड़िया के साथ खेले।
ऋषभ को गुड़िया के साथ खेलने देना चाहिए और दूसरे बच्चों को कहना चाहिए कि वे भी अपनी पसंद का कोई खिलौना चुन सकते हैं।

en.value: In order to help students to become good problem solvers, a teacher should emphasize on practice of :

options.value: centering only on one particular piece of information related to problem.
focusing on information that confirms existing beliefs and preconceptions.
approaching problems in a particular fixed fashion.
breaking large complex problems into smaller manageable problems.

hn.value: <p>छात्रों को अच्छे समस्या समाधानकर्ता बनने में मदद करने के लिए, एक शिक्षक को निम्नलिखित के अभ्यास पर जोर देना चाहिए:</p>

options.value: समस्या से संबंधित जानकारी के केवल एक ही पहलू पर ध्यान केंद्रित करना।
ऐसी जानकारी पर ध्यान देना जो पहले से मौजूद विश्वासों और पूर्वाग्रहों की पुष्टि करें।
समस्याओं को एक विशिष्ट निर्धारित तरीके से हल करना।
बड़ी और जटिल समस्याओं को छोटी प्रबंधनीय समस्याओं में विभाजित करना।

en.value: Children learn better if they experience:

options.value: Low level of alertness during activity
Moderate level of excitement to learn
High degree of anxiety to perform

hn.value: बच्चे बेहतर सीखते हैं यदि वे निम्नलिखित अनुभव करें:

options.value: गतिविधि के दौरान निम्न स्तर की सतर्कता
सीखने के लिए मध्यम स्तर का उत्साह

en.value: Lawrence Kohlberg argued that:

options.value: there are gender differences in moral reasoning of children.&nbsp;
moral development in children occurs in a continuous manner.
there are cultural differences in moral reasoning of children.&nbsp;
moral development occurs progressively in stages.&nbsp;

hn.value: लॉरेंस कोहलबर्ग ने तर्क दिया है कि

options.value: बच्चों के नैतिक तर्क में लैंगिक अंतर है।
बच्चों में नैतिक विकास निरंतर रूप से होता है।
बच्चों के नैतिक तर्क में सांस्कृतिक अंतर होते हैं।
नैतिक विकास क्रमिक चरणों में होता है।
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।

सिद्धि, एक कक्षा 4 की शिक्षिका है। वह अपनी कक्षा के बच्चों को एनसीईआरटी के पर्यावरण अध्ययन की पाठ्यपुस्तक का पाठ 10 “हु तू तू, हु तू तू" पढ़ाने के लिए सभी बच्चों को वह खेल के मैदान में ले जाकर कबड्डी खेल खिलाती है। खेल खेलने से पहले वह सभी बच्चों को इस खेल के नियम भी बताती है। शिक्षिका इस खेल को खेलने से पहले बच्चों को नियम क्यों बताती है ? निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा सबसे उपयुक्त कारण हो सकता है ?

(A) वह बच्चों का ध्यान इस ओर खींचना चाहती है कि खेल की तरह ही जीवन में भी हम नियम बनाते हैं।

(B) ताकि सभी कार्य सही ढंग से किए जाएं।

(C) हम सभी समाज में इसी प्रकार से नियमों से बंधे हैं जिसके द्वारा हम आपस में मतभेद और झगड़े सुलझाते हैं।

(D) नियम बनाने से सभी बच्चों का ध्यान खेल की अपेक्षा नियम पर बहुत अधिक रहता है।

Activity strengthens the cognitive domain to a greater extent than the other domains of learning in children.

hn.value: एक शिक्षक अपनी पर्यावरण अध्ययन की कक्षा में बच्चों को समूह में बांटकर, विद्यालय में मौजूद उनसे कुछ वस्तुएं इकट्ठे करने को कहता है। इसके बाद वह बच्चों के साथ बैठकर उन वस्तुओं को विभिन्न समूह में बांटने के लिए कहता है। बच्चे वस्तुओं को उनके गुणों के आधार पर विभिन्न समूह में बांट देते हैं। शिक्षक के द्वारा इस गतिविधि को कराने का क्या सबसे उपयुक्त उद्देश्य हो सकता है ?

options.value: गतिविधि कराने से बच्चे परिभाषा और तथ्यों को समझने में बहुत कम गलतियां करते हैं।
गतिविधि बच्चों में सीखने के अन्य पक्षों की तुलना में संज्ञानात्मक पक्ष को काफी हद तक मजबूत करती है।
गतिविधि बच्चों के सभी अवधारणाओं की समझ विकसित करती है।
प्राथमिक स्तर पर बच्चे एक दूसरे के साथ अंतः क्रिया करते हुए बेहतर तरीके से सीख पाते हैं।

A is correct but B is incorrect.

कथन A एवं B को ध्यान से पढ़ें:

कथन B : कुछ ऋतुओं में, कुछ जानवर लम्बी, गहरी निद्रा में चले जाते हैं।

en.value: Mr. Upadhyay&#39;s professional role in the institution was that of...
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow:

Shreeram Lagoo was acting in a play staged at Ambernath's Gandhi School. We had managed get the tickets for the play after much running around. We left the hostel quietly after eating dinner the mess. The play started at 9.30 p.m. and it was already 9.15 p.m. Patil and I were rushing along road to the station. Suddenly we saw Upadhyayji coming from the opposite direction. He had seen 'Maharshi, where are you off to at this time?' he said reprovingly.

We looked at each other's face. Suddenly Patil spoke up, 'Sir, I have a headache. We are goin the station to have some tea or coffee. We will be back right after drinking a cup.'

'Why, don't you get tea and coffee in the mess?"

We do, Sir. But today there wasn't any milk in the mess. That's why we are going to the stat Patil improvised.

Upadhyay said, 'Come with me. I'll get you some coffee.' He brought us to his home. The tick for the play were squirming in our pockets. We couldn't work out how to get him off our backs.

After seating us in the drawing room, he asked his wife to make the coffee and sat on the across from us.

As soon as Mrs. Upadhyay entered the kitchen, I got up and said, 'Ammaji, Warden Saheb bothering you unnecessarily. I will make the coffee'.

She was pleased to see me. 'Maharshi, you go sit ... I will make it.'

I went up to her and whispered, 'Ammaji, both of us were going to the Gandhi School to s play. Warden Saheb waylaid us and brought us here. See, here are the tickets, but he doesn't k anything.'

Ammaji examined me from head to toe. 'I see. Is it a good play?'

I said, 'Ammaji, it is very good.'

'Then why don't you go?' she said with a laugh.

'How can we go? Warden Saheb won't give us permission', I whispered.

She came into the drawing room. Listen, what kind of a warden are you? Why don't you children go and have some fun? Go, Maharshi, but don't be too late.

what is that sound which so thrills the ear

Down in the valley drumming, drumming?

Only the scarlet soldiers, dear,

The soldiers coming.

O what is that light I see flashing so clear

Over the distance brightly, brightly?

Only the sun on their weapons, dear,

As they step lightly.

O what are they doing with all that gear,

What are they doing this morning, this morning?

Only the usual manoeuvres, dear,

Or perhaps a warning.

O why have they left the road down there,

Why are they suddenly wheeling, wheeling?

Perhaps a change in the orders, dear,

Why are you kneeling?

en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow: 

A couple of days later, there was a music recital in the Bharatendu Auditorium, one of the two largest auditoriums in town. One of the performers was Ustad Majeed Khan.

Lata and Malati both managed to get tickets. So did Hema, a tall, thin and high-spirited friend of theirs who lived with innumerable cousins-boys and girls-in a house not far from Nabiganj. They were all under the care of a strict elder member of the family who was referred to by everyone as Tauji. Hema's Tauji had quite a job on his hands, as he was not only responsible for the well-being and reputation of the girls of the family but also had to make sure that the boys did not get into the countless kinds of mischief that boys are prone to. He had often cursed his luck that he was the sole representative in a university town of a large and far-flung family. He had on occasions threatened to send everyone straight back home when they had caused him more trouble than he could bear. But his wife, Taiji to everyone, thought she herself had been brought up with almost no liberty or latitude, felt it was a great pity that her nieces and grandnieces should be similarly constrained. She managed to obtain for the girls what they could not obtain by a more direct approach.

This evening Hema and her cousin had thus succeeded in reserving the use of Tauji's large maroon Packard car and went around town collecting their friends for the concert. No sooner was Tauji out of sight than they had entirely forgotten his outraged parting comment. "Flowers? Flowers in your hair? Rushing off in exam time- and listening to all this pleasure - music! Everyone will think you are completely dissolute-you will never get married."

en.value: How did Taiji manage to get concessions for the girls?

en.value: The narrator left Baghdad because.....&nbsp;
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow: 

I designed, after my first voyage, to spend the rest of my days at Baghdad, but it was not long ere grew weary of an indolent life and I put to sea a second time with merchants of known probity. We embarked on board of a good ship and set sail. One day we landed on an island covered with several sorts of fruit trees, but we could see neither man nor animal. While some diverted themselves with gathering flowers, and other fruits, I took my wine and provisions and sat down near a stream betwixt two high trees, which afforded a delightful shade. I made a good meal and afterwards fell asleep. When I woke up, the ship was no longer in view.

In this sad condition, I was ready to die with grief. When I gazed towards the sea, I could discern nothing but sky and water, but looking over the land I beheld something white, and coming down, I took what provision I had left and went towards the object which was so distant that at first could not distinguish what it was.

As I approached, I thought it to be a white dome of a prodigious height and extent. I drew near to it, and walked round it and found no door to it. I found that I had not strength nor activity to climb it on account of its exceeding smoothness. I went round the dome measuring its circumference. I meditated upon some means of gaining an entrance into it but no means of accomplishing this occurred to me.

By this time the sun was about to set, and all of a sudden the sky became as dark as if it had been covered with a thick cloud. I was much astonished at this sudden darkness but much more when I found it occasioned by a bird of a most extraordinary size that came flying towards me. I remembered that I had often heard mariners speak of a miraculous bird called the roc, and conceived that the great dome which I so much admired must be her egg. Shortly afterwards the bird alighted and sat over the egg.

options.value: He was weary of the city
He was keen to visit another city&nbsp;
He did not want to live a lazy life

I remembered that I had often heard mariners speak of a miraculous bird called the roc, and conceived that the great dome which I so much admired must be her egg. Shortly afterwards the bird alighted and sat over the egg.

en.value: Identify the tense of the underlined word in: &#39;I <u>drew</u> near to it....&quot;
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow: 

I designed, after my first voyage, to spend the rest of my days at Baghdad, but it was not long ere grew weary of an indolent life and I put to sea a second time with merchants of known probity. We embarked on board of a good ship and set sail. One day we landed on an island covered with several sorts of fruit trees, but we could see neither man nor animal. While some diverted themselves with gathering flowers, and other fruits, I took my wine and provisions and sat down near a stream betwixt two high trees, which afforded a delightful shade. I made a good meal and afterwards fell asleep. When I woke up, the ship was no longer in view.

In this sad condition, I was ready to die with grief. When I gazed towards the sea, I could discern nothing but sky and water, but looking over the land I beheld something white, and coming down, I took what provision I had left and went towards the object which was so distant that at first could not distinguish what it was.

As I approached, I thought it to be a white dome of a prodigious height and extent. I drew near to it, and walked round it and found no door to it. I found that I had not strength nor activity to climb it on account of its exceeding smoothness. I went round the dome measuring its circumference. I meditated upon some means of gaining an entrance into it but no means of accomplishing this occurred to me.

By this time the sun was about to set, and all of a sudden the sky became as dark as if it had been covered with a thick cloud. I was much astonished at this sudden darkness but much more when I found it occasioned by a bird of a most extraordinary size that came flying towards me. I remembered that I had often heard mariners speak of a miraculous bird called the roc, and conceived that the great dome which I so much admired must be her egg. Shortly afterwards the bird alighted and sat over the egg.
